The sketch will have one face (face\_1) and six lines, forming a closed loop. Here are the lines' details: - line\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.287], End Point [0.1657, 0.0] - line\_2: Start Point [0.1657, 0.0], End Point [0.497, 0.0] - line\_3: Start Point [0.497, 0.0], End Point [0.6627, 0.287] - line\_4: Start Point [0.6627, 0.287], End Point [0.497, 0.5739] - line\_5: Start Point [0.497, 0.5739], End Point [0.1657, 0.5739] - line\_6: Start Point [0.1657, 0.5739], End Point [0.0, 0.287] The sketch has six lines, three of which form the bottom and top edges of the prism, and the remaining ones form the two sides of the prism. Notice that all the lines are connected-end-to-end in a closed loop. Scale the sketch using the scaling parameter, sketch\_scale = 0.6627. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal by 0.75 units to generate the 3D model. Set the `operation` to `NewBodyFeatureOperation`. **Part 2 Instructions** Create a three-dimensional geometric shape with a combination of rectangular and triangular facets as the second part. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0438, 0.0, 0.0379] Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system, then create a new face (face\_1).
